summary: The School Violence Prevention Act (HR 3968) authorizes the establishment of a comprehensive school-based violence prevention program. It provides grants to eligible entities (partnerships of state and local educational agencies with community-based nonprofits) to implement evidence-based programs targeting youth at highest risk for gun violence. These programs focus on activities like community engagement, trauma healing, skill-building, and connecting youth to support services. The bill also includes provisions for data collection, evaluation, and dissemination of best practices. Funding is authorized for fiscal years 2025-2031.
